websitePreview: Media release Shorten doesn’t care about Aussie workers       Federal Leader of the United Australia Party, Clive Palmer, says Bill Shorten’s plan to boost foreign workers’ wages showed how little the Labor leader cared about everyday Australians. “Why pay overseas workers more than Australian workers?” Mr Palmer said. “The plan should be to pay Australian workers more. “Bill Shorten doesn’t care about Australians. He didn’t care about them when he was a unionist and he will care even less for them if he was to become Prime Minister,’’ Mr Palmer said...
wikipediaPreview: The United Australia Party (UAP) was an Australian political party that was founded in 1931 and dissolved in 1945. The party won four federal elections in that time, usually governing in coalition with the Country Party. It provided two Prime Ministers of Australia – Joseph Lyons (1932–1939) and Robert Menzies (1939–1941). The UAP was created in the aftermath of the 1931 split in the Australian Labor Party. Six economically conservative Labor MPs left the party to protest the Scullin Government's financial policies during the Great Depression...
